title: Odion Ighalo - Wikipedia
snippet: On 15 August 2023, Ighalo joined Al-Wehda on a free transfer. On 24 March 2015, after a series of strong performances for Watford, newly appointed Nigeria interim coach Daniel Amokachi selected Ighalo for the first time, and the latter stated, "I feel good because it is my dream to play for ...

title: Odion Ighalo: Saudi Professional League Player Watch - Coaches' Voice
snippet: Manchester United loaned Odion Ighalo from Shanghai Shenhua, and the striker has since moved on to Al Shabab of the Saudi Professional League

title: Al-Shabab FC - Current and former staff | Transfermarkt

title: Nigeria’s Afcon-bound Ighalo on target as Al Shabab edge out Al Ahli Saudi | Goal.com
snippet: This could be Ighalo’s last match for Al Shabab for a while as he is among the players summoned by Nigeria interim coach Augustine Eguavoen for the Africa Cup of Nations set to kick off on January 9 in Cameroon.

title: Former Man United striker Ighalo joins Saudi side Al Shabab | Reuters
snippet: He is the latest high-profile foreigner to leave the Chinese Super League following the departure of Brazilian striker Hulk from Shanghai SIPG and coach Rafa Benitez from Dalian Pro.
